info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 3:55PM EST until February 04 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THURSDAY TO 3 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, sleet, and some light freezing rain expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 6 to 12 inches north of Highway 17 and I-88, with a sharp dropoff to around 4 inches near the NY and PA border. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Chemung, Chenango, Otsego, Tioga and Broome counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM Thursday to 3 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light rain and snow is possible tonight, but the main hazardous weather will arrive Thursday. Rain will change to snow and sleet, with some spotty freezing rain. There will be a sharp gradient of snowfall amounts, with areas near and south of the I-88 and Highway 17 corridor, including the Triple Cities, seeing considerable amounts of sleet, cutting into snow totals. The precipitation will transition to all snow Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
